name: Kempinski Hotel Soma Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 110% perfect in every regards. In a very short time the new restaurants and bars will open, offering more dining opportunities, but already now it was exceeding our expectations. Our expectations were based on all the excellent reviews of Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: Perfect place to relax, chill out and enjoy the outstanding cuisine in a very luxuary environment. If you want more action/activities (and Germans) you can always join the Robinson or Sheraton that are just next door.
reviews.title: Amazing !
Absolulutely Brilliant
reviews.text: Thank you Kempinski and the fantastic staff, we will come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cant put in words how much i loved this hotel. I had an amazing time there. It is definately the nicest in Soma Bay ( i visited the robinson,sheraton and cascades).
reviews.title: Feel like a King

reviews.text: The view is stunning, the hotel design is beautiful, service was excellent, food was great (breakfast and dinner). The beach was lovely, and sunset at the beach is gorgeous. It was excellent for the for a first snorkeler like me. The coral reef is so close to shore and so pretty and crowed with beautiful multicoloured fish. Unforgettable.
reviews.title: Fantastic..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this hotel for some winter sun at the end of 2009 and had a really enjoyable time. The grounds of the hotel are brilliant with both the beach and the lazy river sticking out in my mind as fantastic.
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel but needs a little polishing around the edges

reviews.text: Our room itself was nice enough but it wasn't massive - I was hoping for something a little more special and luxurious. It seemed no better and no worse than other nice hotels I've stayed at in Egypt (Hyatts, Hiltons etc). Still, I had a great sea view and the patio was lovely for sitting out on in the evening. My only criticism was that housekeeping was a little poor. The room itself was kept lovely and clean, but when we used glasses they weren't ever replaced with clean ones. After a few days we had to ring down (three times over the space of a day) before we got any new ones. There also seemed to be plates and glasses littered around the hallways which housekeeping ignored.
reviews.title: Hotel Good, Food&Beverage Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the hotel was brilliant. The German chef had a slightly strange sense of humour but we forgave him after tasting some of the roast beef he served up. I ate everything you're not supposed to in Egypt - unpeeled vegetables, ice cream etc - and not a hint of any of the troubles you normally see. The buffet was pricey (came to about 100 euros per night for two of us and a bottle of wine) but it was clear that the food and the chef's skill were worth the money. The only slight downside was that the restaurant staff weren't that great ... they could be exceptionally slow at bringing you drinks and often we were completely ignored until we flagged a member of staff down. Still, we loved Tarik who was a very welcoming and friendly host.
reviews.title: Delightful Staff. Fabulous pool and beach. Early days and must make pricing (for food) abit lower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During the day we tended to lounge around the pool and go to the nearby Al Mar bar at lunch time. The food here was also great, and much more competitively priced .... the lamb shawarma will hold a special place in our hearts for the intensely garlicy breath it gave you (we love garlic so this isn't a bad thing). The staff here were faultless and this truly showed off what the hotel could be like.
reviews.title: Excellent - We will go back in 2010

reviews.text: We went to the main bar in the evening and, while the atmosphere was great, we felt the staff let it down somewhat. They were very friendly but tended to ignore you unless you waved them down. I had to go to the bar and order my own drinks numerous times ... fine for a reasonable hotel but not fine for one in the Kempinski's price range.
reviews.title: Junior suite for a family of four not a workable option

reviews.text: Soma Bay is a small peninsular about 45 minutes drive from Hurghada airport, it consists of a cluster of hotels, championship golf course and a superb spa. It is a very quiet resort suitable for reading , relaxing and watersports. Water temperature 28 degrees fantastic.
reviews.title: A Rising Star

reviews.text: The Kempinski is the latest addition to Soma Bay, It is currently going through its soft opening stage, which means there is still some building work to be done in time for the official opening in October.
reviews.title: Amazing addition to Soma Bay

reviews.text: I have just spent a very relaxing and luxurious week at the Kempinski and not the least bit troubled by the on going development.
reviews.title: Great test stay

likes.liked: — The beach with top kite surfing conditions as well as the pool.
likes.disliked: — The TV setup still needs to be fixed as some channels one day work and the other day won't.

reviews.text: The overall impression of this new hotel is amazing, the design and architecture are superb. Eventually this hotel will have just over 300 rooms, but the space and design leaves you with an impression you are staying in a elite beachside village with water features and swimming pools everywhere.
reviews.title: Kempinski Hotel Soma Bay - Lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — The farewell and the friendly staff

description: Where the Red Sea mountain range blends majestically with aquamarine waters and pristine sandy beaches: this is Soma Bay. Overlooking one of the finest beaches you find the Kempinski Hotel Soma Bay, the first Kempinski luxury hotel in Egypt. Come and enjoy.
